results.title: The Waterboy
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Robert Simonds, Jack Giarraputo and Frank Coraci
results.brief_description: In this comedic film of sight gags Adam Sandler plays the role of Bobby Boucher, a water boy for the local college football team. Bobby cops it from all directions - his over-bearing mother (Kathy Bates), the football team and even the coach (Jerry Reed). When the coach fires him, Bobby is forced to join the rival team under Coach Klein (Henry Winkler) where he turns his talents from water boy to a star tackler setting this losing team on the road to victory. Love, glory and revenge await Bobby as he takes up his new life as a football hero and college student. Cast includes Fairuza Balk, Blake Clark and Larry Gilliard Jr.

results.title: The Wasp woman [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Film Group Feature, Santa Cruz Productions and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: A beautiful woman by day - a lusting queen wasp by night. Janice Starlin (Susan Cabot), cosmetics entrepreneur and former model approaching middle age, teams up with an unemployed research scientist who has just developed a youth serum derived from wasps. Starlin volunteers to be a human guinea pig, to the horror of her employees and corporate advisers. The serum cuts eighteen years off her age and makes her radiant, but Starlin learns that there are a few flies in the ointment. The epitome of B-films, Corman quickly pushes aside trivial matters such as logic and science to create a great yarn, although his treatment of the story written by Leo Gordon and Kinta Zertuche, confuses the audience as to whether this film concerns bees or wasps. Music by Fred Katz.

results.title: The War of the worlds
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, George Pal and Byron Haskin
results.brief_description: H.G. Wells’ classic tale about the invasion of the Earth by Martians has inspired and terrified people for many decades. Its translation into film was even more frightening, as audiences felt the panic and saw the destruction, as Martian machines, swan-shaped, ticking and hissing menacingly, destroyed everything in their path. In order to modernise Well’s ideas, the original story was updated to include the atom bomb; ineffectual against the Martians. The film won an Academy Award for special effects. Staring Gene Barry, Ann Robinson and Les Tremayne.

results.title: The Virgin queen
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Charles Brackett and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: Bette Davis gives her second memorable performance as Queen Elizabeth I in this swashbuckling historical drama that also features Joan Collins in an early screen performance. It is the story of the aging queen’s attraction to handsome Sir Walter Raleigh (Richard Todd) and her bitter clash with a scheming, younger rival (Collins). Rich in historical detail, lavish with authentic cotumes and period decor and enlivened by thrilling swordplay, “The Virgin Queen” is a legendary re-creation of one of England’s most fascinating eras, made all the more alluring by Davis’ dynamic performance.

results.title: The Vikings
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jerry Bresler and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: Set in an era rife with bloody raids, gory sword battles and brutal acts of violence, this is the saga of the loves and lusts of the fierce Norse raiders who swept over Europe bringing death and destruction over a thousand years ago. Leading an all-star cast is Kirk Douglas as Einar, hot-blooded, hedonistic son of the Viking chieftain Ragnar (Ernest Borgnine). Years before, Ragnar had molested the British Queen Enid, murdered her husband and left her with child. Enid had secretly sent the baby away to protect the rightful heir from the Viking invaders. Twenty years later, the child grows up to become the proud slave, Eric (Tony Curtis), whose true identity - and love for the Welsh princess Morgana (Janet Leigh) - forces him into an inevitable, climactic showdown with his vicious half-brother, Einar. The authentically staged raids and magnificently filmed panoramas of the Norwegian Fjords and the rugged French coast make this a spectacular and thrilling adventure tale.

results.title: The Verdict
results.creator_credit: Richard Zanuck, David Brown, Sidney Lumet and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A courtroom drama starring Paul Newman as Frank Galvin, an alcoholic Boston lawyer struggling to make a living. Approached to represent a comatose young woman in a medical negligence case, he uses the opportunity to redeem himself and resurrect his career. Initially willing to accept a settlement that will alleviate his financial situation and avoid a confrontation with a large law firm, he decides to go to trial and fight for justice. James Mason plays an unscrupulous lawyer, prepared to use any tactic to defend the doctor at the centre of the malpractice claim. Also Stars Charlotte Rampling and Jack Warden. Screenplay by David Mamet, based on the novel by Barry Reed.

results.title: The Van
results.creator_credit: BBC, Deadly Films, Lynda Myles and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Set during the 1989 World Cup season when Ireland’s national identity is intricately wrapped up in its sporting success, “The Van” follows the relationship of lifelong friends, Brendan (Bimbo) and Larry. Larry, long time unemployed and living on welfare, finds his professional friend Bimbo joining the ranks of the unemployed when he is retrenched. With the help of a dodgy associate, Bimbo purchases a dilapidated van and miraculously cleans it up to create the modest business enterprise of Bimbo’s Burgers. He asks his best mate Larry to work for him, and soon Larry’s daughter Diane and vegetarian son Kevin begin work with them to cater for the soccer, beach and concert crowds. As the pressure of working long hours, meeting stringent health regulations and Bimbo’s dismay at Larry’s work ethic weighs on them, Larry and Bimbo push the boundaries of their relationship, forcing them to choose between being partners and being friends. With a soundtrack by Eric Clapton, “The Van” is the final chapter in Roddy Doyle’s Barrytown trilogy. Cast includes Colm Meaney, Donal O’Kelly, Neili Conroy and Ger Ryan.

results.title: The Usual suspects [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Blue Parrot, Bad Hat Harry, Bryan Singer and Michael McDonnell
results.brief_description: Usually when there is a crime, there is a motive. Usually when there is a line up, there is only one real suspect. However, this is not the usual crime and when five criminals are in the same lineup, there is a force operating behind the scenes pulling the strings to get them all together. “The Usual suspects” has an intriguing and twisted plot with exceptional performances from the entire cast which includes Gabriel Byrne, Stephen Baldwin, Kevin Pollak, Pete Postlethwaite, Chazz Palminteri and Kevin Spacey.

results.title: The Unvanquished = Aparajito
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bibhutibhushan Banerji, this is the second part of the trilogy begun by Pather Panchali. Apu grows up and becomes restless for experience. Set in Benares in the 1920’s, the focus is on the changing environment, contrasted with the stasis of village life in Pather Panchali. Apu’s restlessness and desire for more education brings him into conflict with his mother. This realistic portrayal of family life drew a good deal of criticism from the middle class audience of the time.

results.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lawrence Weingarten and Helen Deutsch
results.brief_description: Debbie Reynolds stars in her Oscar nominated performance as the eponymous Molly Brown. Destined for better things, Western orphan Molly leaves her mountain cabin and her uneducated and poor upbringing in search of a rich husband and a better life in Denver society. In a typical rags to riches fashion, Molly becomes the wealthiest woman in society. Based on the musical play with music and lyrics by Meredith Wilson. Screen play by Helen Deutsch. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Harve Presnell and Ed Begley.
